title: Associate Data Analyst
description: Our Company:At Impact our culture is our soul. We are passionate about our people, our technology, and are obsessed with customer success. Working together enables us to grow rapidly, win, and serve the largest brands in the world. We use cutting edge technology to solve real world problems for our clients and continue to pull ahead of the pack as the leading SaaS platform for businesses to automate their partnerships and grow their revenue like never before. We work with enterprise and innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi’s, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage all different types of partnerships. From social influencers, B2B, strategic partners, publishers, and traditional affiliates, we have them covered. Our combined suite of products covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008 by the same team that founded Commission Junction, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across the United States, Europe, Africa, and Asia.Why this role is exciting:The associate data analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting large and complex datasets to identify patterns and trends, surfacing facts and assist in developing insights and providing data-driven outputs and recommendations to support business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in and some prior experience of data analysis, reporting and forecasting. The associate data analyst needs to be a clear communicator that can confidently interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.The associate data analyst will form part of and actively participate in the data analytics competency, with special focus on building data and reporting outputs as directed by senior team members. sources including relational databases (mySQL, postgres), big data technologies (BigQuery, Kudu, Impala, SingleStore, Hive), file sources (parquet, ORC, avro, csv, xlsx) and reporting systems (Looker, outputsContribute to technical specifications for new data assets (marts, tables, views, cubes)Analyze source systems and help identify business logic embedded in the underlying datasetsUse statistical techniques to identify trends and derive patterns and insights embedded in the dataIdentify and communicate data quality and data validation issues in productionalized datasetsCreate non-technical team members in a clear and concise mannerDoes this sound like you?Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science or a related field2+ years of experience in a data analysis, business intelligence or data engineering roleAnalytical and problem-solving skillsPython and SQL coding skillsDemonstrable data analysis and data visualization skillsExposure to the title: Data financial analyst
description: You love to help organizations become successful with Data and Artificial Intelligence.You enjoy solving complex problems and offering practical conclusions based on real business data. You feel comfortable to approach stakeholders and help them to uncover the needs of their business. And you are not afraid to take ownership and make sure the right solution goes into production.This is a job for you!The Data Value Measurement is a brand-new approach that helps organization to perform and improve their processes in terms of value generation. You will be part of a global program inside Orange with interactions with countries from Europe, Middle East Africa and entities within OBS (Orange Business Services), WIN (Wholesale International Network).The core team is leading the governance and defining recommendation to execute the value measurement. We are supporting teams to uncover the value areas per business domain. You will be part of a dynamic and agile team, composed by four people: the program manager, two data translators, a data scientist and you. You will work alongside Data translators and report directly to the program manager.We need a new talent, who:· Is entrepreneurial at heart, a strong communicator.· Has at least 5 years hands-on experience with finance or business modelingThe Data financial analyst role is key to the future of Orange as we develop a truly Data Driven Culture. This new position brings a unique skill set to help businesses increase the return on investment for their initiatives.Your mission is to ensure that organizations achieve real impact from their Data and AI initiatives.- Analytical and Critical thinking. You will participate to workshops organized with stakeholders to explore the risk, benefit and impact of a Data and AI initiatives.- Financial statement review. You will develop innovative solutions for operational and strategic change, with budget and value forecasting to ensure that costs do not exceed the limit. This includes producing Excel file template for framing the values in the initial Business case exercise.- Value cockpit for finance. You will translate all the value clusters identified into financial impact to meet financial objectives. This includes developing and implementing accounting policies and procedures that help affiliates make important financial and operational decision.- Evangelize your peers – the financial guys. You will convert local controllers into the value management and create documents to outline the proposed changes and steps to involved. This includes getting their approval and commitment for changes. What you need to know/have:The Data Value Measurement methodology foundation is based on a cross-functional team: data squad, business owners and the financial guy.- Good understanding of predictive model’s impact- Working experience in complex and multicultural environment- Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines- Results focus, problem solving- AutonomyWhat will make you the proper candidate for this job position- Relevant experience in business plan production for investment committee.- Mathematical proficiency and analytical ability- Proficient in MS excel, Powerpoint etc- Eyes for detail – track and record value generation- Excellent written and spoken English and local languages (preferably also French)- ACCA certification would be a plusEducation and experience (minimum level requested):- Master’s degree in finance, accounting, or business administration- Work experience in a similar position at least 5 years

title: Specialist Data & Analytics Business Performance
description: Role PurposeJoin the Vodacom Group Data & Analytics team as a member of the Business Performance team. In this team, you will have the opportunity to add meaningful value to the business and advance your analytics career as we embark on a journey to advance and digitalize the management of our KPIs. The position will allow an individual to advance their data analytical skills as well as gain considerable stakeholder management experience as they work with businesses to understand the business rules to be considered in the development of KPIs.Your Responsibilities Will IncludeKPI DevelopmentDocument the KPI definitions and supporting business rules for all Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and build KPIs from high quality and reliable data assetsKPI Availability Ensure standard use of KPIs across business through a central, self-service application for obtaining data assets, their definitions, and approved scripts. Assist business users in understanding KPIs and the related tools for accessing themData AnalysisTo support the data governance analysts in understanding the data structures and KPIs associated with each data asset.Data Reconciliation Ensure data reconciles between different systems, between user outputs and between different tables within the enterprise data warehouseBusiness Performance Obtain a detailed understanding of Vodacom’s financial and related drivers to understand business performance trends and easily identify exceptionsThe Ideal Candidate For This Role Will HaveMust have technical/professional qualifications: Degree/diploma in computer science, management accounting, or related degree/diplomaKnowledge of SQL and working with relational databasesTrained in Agile to deliver as part of a high-performance diverse team across different technical capabilitiesExperience in Finance and HFM is considered to favorablebleTelecommunication experience would be advantageousCore Competencies, Knowledge, And ExperienceData Analyst – experience in interpreting and analyzing complex & huge volumes of data through effective data processing and query languagesAnalytical Skills – Problem solving ability to identify where business processes don’t support the creation of accurate dataAgile Experience – Ability to work in an Agile squad, working in a cross functional team to ensure incremental data product deliveryReporting experience – Experience in business performance reporting for large organisations and knowledge of financial measures and related drivers.Team player: Excellent team player capable of supporting the different D&A teams with business analyst requirementsApplication knowledge: Good working knowledge of Microsoft Exchange, Word, Excel Project, PowerPoint and Visio/Bizagi and Jira.Closing date for Applications: 27 April 2023 The base location for this role is, Midrand, Vodacom Campus.The Company’s approved Employment title: Market Data Analyst
description: London or Cape TownWhy Confluence? Over the past several years we have undergone a great deal of positive change and growth to become the company we are today. Our global footprint now spans multiple countries, giving our employees the opportunity to get exposure to other countries and cultures. And it stands to reason that none of this would have been possible without the hundreds of hard-working employees who work at Confluence.What do we do?As a leading global technology solutions provider to the investment management industry, Confluence helps clients solve complex investment data challenges across the front, middle and back office. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, Confluence services over 1000 clients in 40 countries, with locations across Europe, North America, South Africa, Australia and Asia.More About The Role & TeamYou will work within a wider global team, based across the UK, Montreal and South Africa.Market Data Governance is responsible for leading all data sourcing, procurement and governance to efficiently and effectively enable spend owners to maximize the value they receive from suppliers and ensure that Confluence negotiates appropriate and best-in-class license terms from leading data providers (e.g. Refinitiv, Morningstar, S&P, MSCI).You will support the Global Head of Market Data Governance in all operational tasks: Market Data Administration, (Inventory Management, Spend and Savings Analysis, Invoice Reconciliation and Usage Reporting) as well as managing operational contract life cycles for assigned vendors eg Equity Exchange.What skills and experience do I need to succeed?You will be able to read contracts like a lawyer and manage financial information like a bookkeeper.You are required to have good knowledge of market data / investment management industry, with excellent attention to detail and good written communication and Excel skills (intermediate/advanced level).Market Data Management (MDM) experience is desirable experience, but not essential.What do we offer?Confluence offers generous benefit packages for team members. As a growing, global organization, we are always looking for ways to ensure that our employees can access benefits that matter to them and their families. This includes:Generous time off packagesGlobal Career Development opportunitiesSocial Events Referral Bonus scheme- $3,000 per successful referralPlus many more!More about the LocationWe offer flexible working options for all employees.You will be based primarily remotely, with travel to the closest office (London Aldwych or Cape Town) approximately once a week. There will also be some international travel (approximately once a year).ValuesWe look for people who align with our 4 values.IntegrityFace reality with honesty, courage and accountabilityImaginationDeal creatively with challenges and envision what the world could beDisciplineBuild good habits into reflexes which become a part of our lifeServiceCommitted to the success of othersIf you would like to find out more about a Career at Confluence, please apply today.We are committed to providing equal opportunities regardless of age, gender, religion or ethnic origin and we give full and fair consideration to the employment and career development of disabled persons, commensurate with their aptitudes and abilities.To understand how and why we hold your data please view the relevant Privacy Statement:

description: DescriptionThe Associate, Data Analysis will analyze and extract actionable recommendations from information collected from all of Evidence Action’s programs. S/he will contribute to the development of appropriate measurement, sampling, and survey strategies and the design of survey instruments to gather quantitative and qualitative data.This position will be a critical piece of the Data Analysis team that operates within Evidence Action’s broader Monitoring, Learning, and Evaluation (MLE) team.Duties And ResponsibilitiesMonitoring and Evaluation Support The Associate, Analysis will provide support and guidance to Evidence Action’s monitoring systems:Contribute to the design of the program monitoring processes to ensure appropriate documentation of all analysis files for ease of replication and explain methodology used in analysis.Document all data management procedures and lessons learned to increase the quality and reliability of data collection for future years and for other geographiesResponsible for maintaining and organizing all data files on identified platforms (like Box etc.) as per agreed protocolsRequirementsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in economics, statistics or another quantitative fieldA minimum of 3+ years of experience in quantitative data analysis  Ability to work under pressure in a working environment that changes suddenly to accommodate new data needsShould possess a strong attention to detail, have real passion of working with data, be able to think and tell a story from the data (Key desirable)A minimum of 3+ years of experience in an analytical and quantitative roleShould have real passion of working with data, be able to think and tell a story from the data Strong working knowledge of quantitative statistical software packages such as Stata, R, etc. with the ability to learn and adapt to new programs (experience with Stata, R and excel highly independently translating new knowledge into practiceWillingness to travelIn addition, this position requires a candidate to:Have a strong commitment to evidence-based practice and policy in the development fieldBe enthusiastic to develop personally and professionally as part of a growing global teamExtremely intellectually curious, service-oriented, and able to conduct, document, and explain complex work streamsPreferred QualificationsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in statistics fieldStrong working knowledge of Stata and R statistical software packagesStrong mathematical skills and proficiency in statisticsStrong interpersonal, communications and analytical skills to work effectively with a team that is geographically dispersedSelf-directed/self-motivating personality, with title: Life Data Analyst
description: We are looking for a Life Data Analyst for a leading reinsurer based in Johannesburg. As an experienced Life insurance professional with at least 6 years' experience in the industry, you will be responsible for analysing and reporting on data content and quality, ensuring compliance with reinsurance treaty conditions and that it is fit for purpose for data users in other departments.As the ideal candidate, you should have a degree in a numerate or analytical science such as Mathematics, Computer Science or Actuarial Science, with extensive experience in working as a SQL data analyst, BI, or related field.You should also have a proven track record of delivering high-quality work within strict timelines, with the ability to communicate effectively in both technical and non-technical terms. during sustaining phases of SAP projects & day to day needs focusing on Human Capital Management.Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.Assist the creating/building reports using SuccessFactors Report stories, canvas reporting, dashboard.Demonstrated experience working with complex business rules and SuccessFactors API’s.Previous experience in reviewing functional and technical requirements with vendors and development teams to ensure business requirements are understood and can be delivered.Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.Build complex reports by combining data from multiple data sources.Develop and implement databases, data prioritize business and information needs.Building, maintaining, and supporting variety of reports utilizing appropriate reporting tools.Building customized reports and enhancement of current reports.Build data flow diagrams, process flow diagrams, dashboards and testing scenarios.Gather user requirements and collaborate with global cross-functional teams including HR, IT, and other lines of business to deliver, design and implement solutions.Oversee and support the daily administration of the SAP SuccessFactors system and its modules.Resolve a wide range of issues and incidents related to SAP Successfactors.Collaborate with HR Leadership, business process owners and other system specialists to configure, maintain, and operate the environment to support our business processes.Perform Position Master and Master Data management activities as defined by relevant policies and management instructions.Create and maintain system and process documentation and related (e.g., pivot tables, macros/VBA, data mining, report-building, PowerQuery) and PowerPoint skills required. SAP SuccessFactors Reporting Stories and/or Microsoft Power BI skills highly desired.Highly skilled with distribution within the ORD/Advanced Analytics tool within SuccessFactors.Experience in designing, defining, and executing User Acceptance Testing (UAT) test strategies, scripts, and defect management.Experience with developing job aid materials and delivering training sessions.Strong data analysis, organizational skills and problem-solving skillsSAP Successfactors Employee Central certification (advantageous)Experience in configuring, testing, implementing, administering, supporting, and reporting on SAP SuccessFactors modules, with broader knowledge across the SuccessFactors platform, including Employee Central (advantageous)If you are interested and meet the above requirements, please apply via the following link: https://apply.workable.com/vivo-energy/j/BEFA775194/

title: Associate Data Analyst
description: Our Company:At Impact our culture is our soul. We are passionate about our people, our technology, and are obsessed with customer success. Working together enables us to grow rapidly, win, and serve the largest brands in the world. We use cutting edge technology to solve real world problems for our clients and continue to pull ahead of the pack as the leading SaaS platform for businesses to automate their partnerships and grow their revenue like never before. We have an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture where ambition and curiosity is rewarded. If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world..then this is the place for you.Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation. We work with enterprise and innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi’s, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage all different types of partnerships. From social influencers, B2B, strategic partners, publishers, and traditional affiliates, we have them covered. Our combined suite of products covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008 by the same team that founded Commission Junction, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across the United States, Europe, Africa, and Asia.Why this role is exciting:The associate data analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting large and complex datasets to identify patterns and trends, surfacing facts and assist in developing insights and providing data-driven outputs and recommendations to support business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in and some prior experience of data analysis, reporting and forecasting. The associate data analyst needs to be a clear communicator that can confidently interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.The associate data analyst will form part of and actively participate in the data analytics competency, with special focus on building data and reporting outputs as directed by senior team members. The analyst will be a contributing member of the analytics center of excellence (ACoE) and adopt best practices as outlined by ACoE leadership.Responsibilities:Extract and analyze data from various sources including relational databases (mySQL, postgres), big data technologies (BigQuery, Kudu, Impala, SingleStore, Hive), file sources (parquet, ORC, avro, csv, xlsx) and reporting systems (Looker, title: Data financial analyst
description: You love to help organizations become successful with Data and Artificial Intelligence.You enjoy solving complex problems and offering practical conclusions based on real business data. You feel comfortable to approach stakeholders and help them to uncover the needs of their business. And you are not afraid to take ownership and make sure the right solution goes into production.This is a job for you!The Data Value Measurement is a brand-new approach that helps organization to perform and improve their processes in terms of value generation. You will be part of a global program inside Orange with interactions with countries from Europe, Middle East Africa and entities within OBS (Orange Business Services), WIN (Wholesale International Network).The core team is leading the governance and defining recommendation to execute the value measurement. We are supporting teams to uncover the value areas per business domain. You will be part of a dynamic and agile team, composed by four people: the program manager, two data translators, a data scientist and you. You will work alongside Data translators and report directly to the program manager.We need a new talent, who:· Is entrepreneurial at heart, a strong communicator.· Has at least 5 years hands-on experience with finance or business modelingThe Data financial analyst role is key to the future of Orange as we develop a truly Data Driven Culture. This new position brings a unique skill set to help businesses increase the return on investment for their initiatives.Your mission is to ensure that organizations achieve real impact from their Data and AI initiatives.- Analytical and Critical thinking. You will participate to workshops organized with stakeholders to explore the risk, benefit and impact of a Data and AI initiatives.- Financial statement review. You will develop innovative solutions for operational and strategic change, with budget and value forecasting to ensure that costs do not exceed the limit. This includes producing Excel file template for framing the values in the initial Business case exercise.- Value cockpit for finance. You will translate all the value clusters identified into financial impact to meet financial objectives. This includes developing and implementing accounting policies and procedures that help affiliates make important financial and operational decision.- Evangelize your peers – the financial guys. You will convert local controllers into the value management and create documents to outline the proposed changes and steps to involved. This includes getting their approval and commitment for changes. What you need to know/have:The Data Value Measurement methodology foundation is based on a cross-functional team: data squad, business owners and the financial guy.- Good understanding of predictive model’s impact- Working experience in complex and multicultural environment- Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines- Results focus, problem solving- AutonomyWhat will make you the proper candidate for this job position- Relevant experience in business plan production for investment committee.- Mathematical proficiency and analytical ability- Proficient in MS excel, Powerpoint etc- Eyes for detail – track and record value generation- Excellent written and spoken English and local languages (preferably also French)- ACCA certification would be a plusEducation and experience (minimum level requested):- Master’s degree in finance, accounting, or business administration- Work experience in a similar position at least 5 years

title: Customer Insights Analyst (x2): Marketing  - Head Office
description: Main Purpose:Bringing the customer to life through the application of data and the integration of multiple sources informing customer behaviour. Support the drive to become a customer-led organisation by partnering with key business stakeholders in the Marketing business unit to inform the overall Marketing and Brand strategy and to deliver customer insights, such that business decisions better reflect the prevailing consumer and market behaviours and deliver stronger more profitable customer relationships.Key Responsibilities:Through the analysis of internal customer data and integration of market research or other secondary data sources, provide robust, relevant, and actionable customer insights to address business questions that will assist in strategic and tactical retail planning. This includes analysis of ad-hoc business questions and continuous customer, marketing campaign & channel performance tracking for future optimization. Work closely with the Brand managers, Marketing stakeholders and stakeholders in the rest of the business to ensure that the organization has a thorough understanding of their customers, through the provision of timeous strategic and operational customer reporting and actionable recommendations. Unpacking key customer KPI's that align to the business strategy at the time and take a holistic approach to customer interactions by providing insights from a single view of the customer perspective.Work closely with the Central Customer Insights & Advanced Analytics team (Customer team) to ensure that specific reporting frameworks, data platforms, research outputs and KPI's are relevant and up to date and to be used as main sources of insights/data.Act as an interface between Customer analytics & insights and the various business units within Marketing, compiling requests for information/insights for prioritisation. Ensure that the full scope of the business requirement is understood and communicated. Review output of the Insights Analysts (might be off shore resources) to ensure quality and consistency, and which meets the objective of guiding the business units and informing their strategy. Execute the Analytics and Insights briefing process and demand management workflows.Represent the Woolworths customer to key Marketing stakeholders including senior leadership in any strategic planning processes.Key competencies:Technical Skills / Experience:A 3-to-4-year Degree of Honours degree in Business Science/Mathematics/Statistics or a similar 4 years (Hons) degree. Minimum 5 years analysis or consultancy experience in retail/marketing or relevant organisation.A minimum 2-5 years' experience in an analytical role specializing in strategic insights(research and analytics), data manipulation, interpretation, and report writing.Experience in working with research agencies, knowledge of research methodologies and processes – advantageous.Experience in data mining and working with large databases.Experience in a large business environment.Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analyzing information and interpreting/translating it into non-technical, commercial recommendations.Ability to turn data into actionable intelligence and insights.SAS or SQL proficient.Advanced MS Excel and MS PowerPoint skills.Knowledge of database segmentation.Business acumen: Proven understanding of business environments and processes with specific focus on marketing campaign & channel optimization and brand building.Ability to apply techniques in a practical way within a business environment.Excellent communications skills: ability to interact effectively with colleagues at all levels of the organization.High attention to detail.Strong planning and organizational skills.Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.Self-motivated.Problem solving ability.Process thinking ability.Conceptual ability.Knowledge of data manipulation software: Insight, Choices, Qliksense, Tableau.Research supplier relationships and networks advantageous.Excellent critical thinking skills.Teamwork: proactively establish and maintain effective working team relationships with all stakeholders.“As a proud South African brand, Woolworths is committed to transformation. Meeting our employment equity goals will be taken into account in our recruitment decisions.”

In this team, you will have the opportunity to add meaningful value to the business and advance your analytics career as we embark on a journey to advance and digitalize the management of our KPIs. The function is required to ensure the organization sources all KPIs centrally from D&A with the assurance that data assets are well governed as the single version of the truth and standard data definitions are used across all reports and analytical use cases.This role will require the individual to have basic data analyst skills such as coding, data visualization creation, and the ability to reconcile different data sources. Assist business users in understanding KPIs and the related tools for accessing themData AnalysisTo support the data governance analysts in understanding the data structures and KPIs associated with each data asset.Data Reconciliation Ensure data reconciles between different systems, between user outputs and between different tables within the enterprise data warehouseBusiness Performance Obtain a detailed understanding of Vodacom’s financial and related drivers to understand business performance trends and easily identify exceptionsThe Ideal Candidate For This Role Will HaveMust have technical/professional qualifications: Degree/diploma in computer science, management accounting, or related degree/diplomaKnowledge of SQL and working with relational databasesTrained in Agile to advantageousCore Competencies, Knowledge, And ExperienceData Analyst – experience in interpreting and analyzing complex & huge volumes of data through effective data processing and query related drivers.Team player: Excellent team player capable of supporting the different D&A teams with business analyst requirementsApplication knowledge: Good working knowledge of Microsoft Exchange, title: Market Data Analyst
description: London or Cape TownWhy Confluence? Over the past several years we have undergone a great deal of positive change and growth to become the company we are today. Our global footprint now spans multiple countries, giving our employees the opportunity to get exposure to other countries and cultures. And it stands to reason that none of this would have been possible without the hundreds of hard-working employees who work at Confluence.What do we do?As a leading global technology solutions provider to the investment management industry, Confluence helps clients solve complex investment data challenges across the front, middle and back office. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, Confluence services over 1000 clients in 40 countries, with locations across Europe, North America, South Africa, Australia and Asia.More About The Role & TeamYou will work within a wider global team, based across the UK, Montreal and South Africa.Market Data Governance is responsible for leading all data sourcing, procurement and governance to efficiently and effectively enable spend owners to maximize the value they receive from suppliers and ensure that Confluence negotiates appropriate and best-in-class license terms from leading data providers (e.g. Refinitiv, Morningstar, S&P, MSCI).You will support the Global Head of Market Data Governance in all operational tasks: Market Data Administration, (Inventory Management, Spend and Savings Analysis, Invoice Reconciliation and Usage Reporting) as well as managing operational contract life cycles for assigned vendors eg Equity Exchange.What skills and experience do I need to succeed?You will be able to read contracts like a lawyer and manage financial information like a bookkeeper.You are required to have good knowledge of market data / investment management industry, with excellent attention to detail and good written communication and Excel skills (intermediate/advanced level).Market Data Management (MDM) experience is desirable experience, but not essential.What do we offer?Confluence offers generous benefit packages for team members. As a growing, global organization, we are always looking for ways to ensure that our employees can access benefits that matter to them and their families. This includes:Generous time off packagesGlobal Career Development opportunitiesSocial Events Referral Bonus scheme- $3,000 per successful referralPlus many more!More about the LocationWe offer flexible working options for all employees.You will be based primarily remotely, with travel to the closest office (London Aldwych or Cape Town) approximately once a week. There will also be some international travel (approximately once a year).ValuesWe look for people who align with our 4 values.IntegrityFace reality with honesty, courage and accountabilityImaginationDeal creatively with challenges and envision what the world could beDisciplineBuild good habits into reflexes which become a part of our lifeServiceCommitted to the success of othersIf you would like to find out more about a Career at Confluence, please apply today.We are committed to providing equal opportunities regardless of age, gender, religion or ethnic origin and we give full and fair consideration to the employment and career development of disabled persons, commensurate with their aptitudes and abilities.To understand how and why we hold your data please view the relevant Privacy Statement:

title: DATA ANALYST-(H/F)
description: Vos missions au quotidienLe Data Analyst aura pour mission principale d'analyser les données de la banque (clients et prospects) afin de déterminer les opportunités de développement et d'optimisation pour accompagner des objectifs de croissance.Collecter, nettoyer et analyser les données clients de la banque etIdentifier les tendances et les opportunités à partir des données analysées et superviser les tendances du marché et les opportunités de développementDévelopper des modèles de prévision pour les indicateurs clés de performance de la banqueTravailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de marketing, produit et technique pour améliorer et faire évoluer notre approche data marketing Et si c’était vous ?Connaissance approfondie des techniques d'analyse de données, y compris la modélisation statistique, la segmentation de données, etc.Expérience en utilisation de logiciels d'analyse de données, tels que R, Python, SAP, Power BI etc.Fortes compétences en communication et en collaboration avec les différentes équipes marketingConnaissance des outils de marketing digital, tels que Google Analytics, Google AdWords, etc.Capacité à travailler de manière autonome et à prendre des décisions rapides en fonction des données disponibles Pourquoi nous choisir ?Chez Société Générale, nous sommes convaincus que les personnes sont moteurs du changement, et que le monde de demain sera fait de toutes leurs initiatives, des plus petites aux plus ambitieuses.Que vous nous rejoigniez pour quelques mois, quelques années ou toute votre carrière, ensemble nous avons les moyens d’avoir un impact positif sur l’avenir. Créer, oser, innover, entreprendre font partie de notre ADN.Si vous aussi vous souhaitez être dans l’action, évoluer dans un environnement stimulant et bienveillant, vous sentir utile au quotidien et développer ou renforcer votre expertise, nous sommes faits pour nous rencontrer !Vous hésitez encore ?Sachez que nos collaborateurs peuvent s’engager quelques jours par an pour des actions de solidarité sur leur temps de travail : parrainer des personnes en difficulté dans leur orientation ou leur insertion professionnelle, participer à l’éducation financière de jeunes en apprentissage ou encore partager leurs compétences avec une association. Les formats d’engagement sont multiples.Nous sommes un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à promouvoir tous les talents, quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, origine ethnique, nationalité, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

title: Life Data Analyst
description: We are looking for a Life Data Analyst for a leading reinsurer based in Johannesburg. As an experienced Life insurance professional with at least 6 years' experience in the industry, you will be responsible for analysing and reporting on data content and quality, ensuring compliance with reinsurance treaty conditions and that it is fit for purpose for data users in other departments.As the ideal candidate, you should have a degree in a numerate or analytical science such as Mathematics, Computer Science or Actuarial Science, with extensive experience in working as a SQL data analyst, BI, or related field.You should also have a proven track record of delivering high-quality work within strict timelines, with the ability to communicate effectively in both technical and non-technical terms. Additionally, you should have strong analytical and numerical skills, with excellent knowledge of Microsoft Excel (able to maintain complex spreadsheets) and MS SQL Server 2012 (or later).Your main responsibilities will include liaising with internal/external clients, understanding data files and treaty rules, setting up regular processes of data receipt, cleaning, loading and reporting, as well as facilitating changes as user requirements change.This is a fixed-term contract position for 12 months and is available immediately. If you meet the minimum requirements and have the necessary skills and experience, please do not hesitate to apply!

title: Associate Data Analyst
description: Our Company:At Impact our culture is our soul. We are passionate about our people, our technology, and are obsessed with customer success. Working together enables us to grow rapidly, win, and serve the largest brands in the world. We use cutting edge technology to solve real world problems for our clients and continue to pull ahead of the pack as the leading SaaS platform for businesses to automate their partnerships and grow their revenue like never before. We have an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture where ambition and curiosity is rewarded. If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world..then this is the place for you.Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation. We work with enterprise and innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi’s, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage all different types of partnerships. From social influencers, B2B, strategic partners, publishers, and traditional affiliates, we have them covered. Our combined suite of products covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008 by the same team that founded Commission Junction, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across the United States, Europe, Africa, and Asia.Why this role is exciting:The associate data analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting large and complex datasets to identify patterns and trends, surfacing facts and assist in developing insights and providing data-driven outputs and recommendations to support business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in and some prior experience of data analysis, reporting and forecasting. The associate data analyst needs to be a clear communicator that can confidently interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.The associate data analyst will form part of and actively participate in the data analytics competency, with special focus on building data and reporting outputs as directed by senior team members. The analyst will be a contributing member of the analytics center of excellence (ACoE) and adopt best practices as outlined by ACoE leadership.Responsibilities:Extract and analyze data from various sources including relational databases (mySQL, postgres), big data technologies (BigQuery, Kudu, Impala, SingleStore, Hive), file sources (parquet, ORC, avro, csv, xlsx) and reporting systems (Looker, DOMO)Assist with the identification, creation and maintenance of master datasetsParticipate in data stewardship initiativesClean and manipulate data to ensure high quality and integrity of reporting outputsContribute to technical specifications for new data assets (marts, tables, views, cubes)Analyze source systems and help identify business logic embedded in the underlying datasetsUse statistical techniques to identify trends and derive patterns and insights embedded in the dataIdentify and communicate data quality and data validation issues in productionalized datasetsCreate visualizations and dashboards as directed by the squad lead and required by business stakeholdersBuild and maintain dashboards and reports to support business stakeholdersPerform ad-hoc data analysis to determine suitability of a data source for use in data marts and reporting outputs or to assess key performance indicators (KPIs)Communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical team members in a clear and concise mannerDoes this sound like you?Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science or a related field2+ years of experience in a data analysis, business intelligence or data engineering roleAnalytical and problem-solving skillsPython and SQL coding skillsDemonstrable data analysis and data visualization skillsExposure to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and integrated technologies preferredExposure to DataBricks, PySpark and BigQuery highly advantageousExposure to data wrangling (data cleaning, manipulation and preparation)Exposure to machine learning libraries, tools and protocols (supervised & unsupervised learning) preferredExposure to standard statistical modeling and forecasting methodologiesExposure to no-sql data systems (HBase, Redis, Kafka) advantageousExposure to data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, SSRS/SSAS, Looker or QlikViewGood verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentExperience working in the marketing technology industry beneficialNice to have: Affiliate & Partnerships Industry Fundamentals Certification by PXABenefits/Perks:Unlimited PTO policyTake the time off that you need. We are truly committed to a positive work-life balance, recognising that it is important to be happy and fulfilled in bothTraining & DevelopmentLearning the advanced partnership automation productsMedical Aid and Provident FundGroup schemes with Discovery & Bonitas for medical aidGroup scheme with Momentum for provident fundStock Options3-year vesting schedule pending Board approvalInternet AllowanceFlexible work hoursCasual work environmentImpact is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, genetics, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or non-binary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. title: Data financial analyst
description: You love to help organizations become successful with Data and Artificial Intelligence.You enjoy solving complex problems and offering practical conclusions based on real business data. You feel comfortable to approach stakeholders and help them to uncover the needs of their business. And you are not afraid to take ownership and make sure the right solution goes into production.This is a job for you!The Data Value Measurement is a brand-new approach that helps organization to perform and improve their processes in terms of value generation. You will be part of a global program inside Orange with interactions with countries from Europe, Middle East Africa and entities within OBS (Orange Business Services), WIN (Wholesale International Network).The core team is leading the governance and defining recommendation to execute the value measurement. We are supporting teams to uncover the value areas per business domain. You will be part of a dynamic and agile team, composed by four people: the program manager, two data translators, a data scientist and you. You will work alongside Data translators and report directly to the program manager.We need a new talent, who:· Is entrepreneurial at heart, a strong communicator.· Has at least 5 years hands-on experience with finance or business modelingThe Data financial analyst role is key to the future of Orange as we develop a truly Data Driven Culture. This new position brings a unique skill set to help businesses increase the return on investment for their initiatives.Your mission is to ensure that organizations achieve real impact from their Data and AI initiatives.- Analytical and Critical thinking. You will participate to workshops organized with stakeholders to explore the risk, benefit and impact of a Data and AI initiatives.- Financial statement review. You will develop innovative solutions for operational and strategic change, with budget and value forecasting to ensure that costs do not exceed the limit. This includes producing Excel file template for framing the values in the initial Business case exercise.- Value cockpit for finance. You will translate all the value clusters identified into financial impact to meet financial objectives. This includes developing and implementing accounting policies and procedures that help affiliates make important financial and operational decision.- Evangelize your peers – the financial guys. You will convert local controllers into the value management and create documents to outline the proposed changes and steps to involved. This includes getting their approval and commitment for changes. What you need to know/have:The Data Value Measurement methodology foundation is based on a cross-functional team: data squad, business owners and the financial guy.- Good understanding of predictive model’s impact- Working experience in complex and multicultural environment- Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines- Results focus, problem solving- AutonomyWhat will make you the proper candidate for this job position- Relevant experience in business plan production for investment committee.- Mathematical proficiency and analytical ability- Proficient in MS excel, Powerpoint etc- Eyes for detail – track and record value generation- Excellent written and spoken English and local languages (preferably also French)- ACCA certification would be a plusEducation and experience (minimum level requested):- Master’s degree in finance, accounting, or business administration- Work experience in a similar position at least 5 years

title: Customer Insights Analyst (x2): Marketing  - Head Office
description: Main Purpose:Bringing the customer to life through the application of data and the integration of multiple sources informing customer behaviour. Support the drive to become a customer-led organisation by partnering with key business stakeholders in the Marketing business unit to inform the overall Marketing and Brand strategy and to deliver customer insights, such that business decisions better reflect the prevailing consumer and market behaviours and deliver stronger more profitable customer relationships.Key Responsibilities:Through the analysis of internal customer data and integration of market research or other secondary data sources, provide robust, relevant, and actionable customer insights to address business questions that will assist in strategic and tactical retail planning. This includes analysis of ad-hoc business questions and continuous customer, marketing campaign & channel performance tracking for future optimization. Work closely with the Brand managers, Marketing stakeholders and stakeholders in the rest of the business to ensure that the organization has a thorough understanding of their customers, through the provision of timeous strategic and operational customer reporting and actionable recommendations. Unpacking key customer KPI's that align to the business strategy at the time and take a holistic approach to customer interactions by providing insights from a single view of the customer perspective.Work closely with the Central Customer Insights & Advanced Analytics team (Customer team) to ensure that specific reporting frameworks, data platforms, research outputs and KPI's are relevant and up to date and to be used as main sources of insights/data.Act as an interface between Customer analytics & insights and the various business units within Marketing, compiling requests for information/insights for prioritisation. Ensure that the full scope of the business requirement is understood and communicated. Review output of the Insights Analysts (might be off shore resources) to ensure quality and consistency, and which meets the objective of guiding the business units and informing their strategy. Execute the Analytics and Insights briefing process and demand management workflows.Represent the Woolworths customer to key Marketing stakeholders including senior leadership in any strategic planning processes.Key competencies:Technical Skills / Experience:A 3-to-4-year Degree of Honours degree in Business Science/Mathematics/Statistics or a similar 4 years (Hons) degree. Minimum 5 years analysis or consultancy experience in retail/marketing or relevant organisation.A minimum 2-5 years' experience in an analytical role specializing in strategic insights(research and analytics), data manipulation, interpretation, and report writing.Experience in working with research agencies, knowledge of research methodologies and processes – advantageous.Experience in data mining and working with large databases.Experience in a large business environment.Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analyzing information and interpreting/translating it into non-technical, commercial recommendations.Ability to turn data into actionable intelligence and insights.SAS or SQL proficient.Advanced MS Excel and MS PowerPoint skills.Knowledge of database segmentation.Business acumen: Proven understanding of business environments and processes with specific focus on marketing campaign & channel optimization and brand building.Ability to apply techniques in a practical way within a business environment.Excellent communications skills: ability to interact effectively with colleagues at all levels of the organization.High attention to detail.Strong planning and organizational skills.Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.Self-motivated.Problem solving ability.Process thinking ability.Conceptual ability.Knowledge of data manipulation software: Insight, Choices, Qliksense, Tableau.Research supplier relationships and networks advantageous.Excellent critical thinking skills.Teamwork: proactively establish and maintain effective working team relationships with all stakeholders.“As a proud South African brand, Woolworths is committed to transformation. Meeting our employment equity goals will be taken into account in our recruitment decisions.”

title: Data Analyst
description: Flutterwave was founded on the principle that every African must be able to participate and thrive in the global economy. To achieve this objective, we have built a trusted payment infrastructure that allows consumers and businesses (African and International) make and receive payments in a convenient borderless manner.Flutterwave’s VisionTo make it easier for Africans to build global businesses that can make and accept any payment, anywhere from across Africa and around the world.Flutterwave’s MissionSimplifying payments for endless possibilities.The role: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst with a minimum of 3 years of experience to join our team. You are an individual who is passionate about data, driven to make a difference, and eager to solve complex problems? In this role, you will have the opportunity to analyze data, provide insights, and drive decision-making. You will be a key member of the team and will play a vital role in shaping the future of our company.Principal Duties and Responsibilities Develop and deliver analytics reporting and Business Intelligence dashboards as required by  business areas  Interpreting data and analysis into impactful, action-orientated reports for internal  stakeholders  Promote a data-driven organization and empower teams with actionable data and automated and intuitive KPI dashboards.  Develop strong cross-functional partnerships across the company (Engineering, Product, Finance, Marketing, Operations, etc.)  Support the team and/or other analysts in the design, construction, and implementation of appropriate analytical processes which support business objectives.  Interface with business teams to understand their data requirements and provide them with actionable insights and reports.  Communicate key findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders using storytelling techniques  Perform ETLs as may be required Competency and Skill Requirement Bachelor’s degree in computer science or other related fields of core sciences or equivalent experience.  Minimum of 3 years experience working as a data analyst.  Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools for data visualization.  Familiarity with SQL and working with relational databases. Python would be a plus.  Exceptional communication/interpersonal skills to articulate ideas, frame problems, and offer solutions. title: Market Data Analyst
description: London or Cape TownWhy Confluence? Over the past several years we have undergone a great deal of positive change and growth to become the company we are today. Our global footprint now spans multiple countries, giving our employees the opportunity to get exposure to other countries and cultures. And it stands to reason that none of this would have been possible without the hundreds of hard-working employees who work at Confluence.What do we do?As a leading global technology solutions provider to the investment management industry, Confluence helps clients solve complex investment data challenges across the front, middle and back office. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, Confluence services over 1000 clients in 40 countries, with locations across Europe, North America, South Africa, Australia and Asia.More About The Role & TeamYou will work within a wider global team, based across the UK, Montreal and South Africa.Market Data Governance is responsible for leading all data sourcing, procurement and governance to efficiently and effectively enable spend owners to maximize the value they receive from suppliers and ensure that Confluence negotiates appropriate and best-in-class license terms from leading data providers (e.g. Refinitiv, Morningstar, S&P, MSCI).You will support the Global Head of Market Data Governance in all operational tasks: Market Data Administration, (Inventory Management, Spend and Savings Analysis, Invoice Reconciliation and Usage Reporting) as well as managing operational contract life cycles for assigned vendors eg Equity Exchange.What skills and experience do I need to succeed?You will be able to read contracts like a lawyer and manage financial information like a bookkeeper.You are required to have good knowledge of market data / investment management industry, with excellent attention to detail and good written communication and Excel skills (intermediate/advanced level).Market Data Management (MDM) experience is desirable experience, but not essential.What do we offer?Confluence offers generous benefit packages for team members. As a growing, global organization, we are always looking for ways to ensure that our employees can access benefits that matter to them and their families. This includes:Generous time off packagesGlobal Career Development opportunitiesSocial Events Referral Bonus scheme- $3,000 per successful referralPlus many more!More about the LocationWe offer flexible working options for all employees.You will be based primarily remotely, with travel to the closest office (London Aldwych or Cape Town) approximately once a week. There will also be some international travel (approximately once a year).ValuesWe look for people who align with our 4 values.IntegrityFace reality with honesty, courage and accountabilityImaginationDeal creatively with challenges and envision what the world could beDisciplineBuild good habits into reflexes which become a part of our lifeServiceCommitted to the success of othersIf you would like to find out more about a Career at Confluence, please apply today.We are committed to providing equal opportunities regardless of age, gender, religion or ethnic origin and we give full and fair consideration to the employment and career development of disabled persons, commensurate with their aptitudes and abilities.To understand how and why we hold your data please view the relevant Privacy Statement:

title: DATA ANALYST-(H/F)
description: Vos missions au quotidienLe Data Analyst aura pour mission principale d'analyser les données de la banque (clients et prospects) afin de déterminer les opportunités de développement et d'optimisation pour accompagner des objectifs de croissance.Collecter, nettoyer et analyser les données clients de la banque etIdentifier les tendances et les opportunités à partir des données analysées et superviser les tendances du marché et les opportunités de développementDévelopper des modèles de prévision pour les indicateurs clés de performance de la banqueTravailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de marketing, produit et technique pour améliorer et faire évoluer notre approche data marketing Et si c’était vous ?Connaissance approfondie des techniques d'analyse de données, y compris la modélisation statistique, la segmentation de données, etc.Expérience en utilisation de logiciels d'analyse de données, tels que R, Python, SAP, Power BI etc.Fortes compétences en communication et en collaboration avec les différentes équipes marketingConnaissance des outils de marketing digital, tels que Google Analytics, Google AdWords, etc.Capacité à travailler de manière autonome et à prendre des décisions rapides en fonction des données disponibles Pourquoi nous choisir ?Chez Société Générale, nous sommes convaincus que les personnes sont moteurs du changement, et que le monde de demain sera fait de toutes leurs initiatives, des plus petites aux plus ambitieuses.Que vous nous rejoigniez pour quelques mois, quelques années ou toute votre carrière, ensemble nous avons les moyens d’avoir un impact positif sur l’avenir. Créer, oser, innover, entreprendre font partie de notre ADN.Si vous aussi vous souhaitez être dans l’action, évoluer dans un environnement stimulant et bienveillant, vous sentir utile au quotidien et développer ou renforcer votre expertise, nous sommes faits pour nous rencontrer !Vous hésitez encore ?Sachez que nos collaborateurs peuvent s’engager quelques jours par an pour des actions de solidarité sur leur temps de travail : parrainer des personnes en difficulté dans leur orientation ou leur insertion professionnelle, participer à l’éducation financière de jeunes en apprentissage ou encore partager leurs compétences avec une association. Les formats d’engagement sont multiples.Nous sommes un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à promouvoir tous les talents, quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, origine ethnique, nationalité, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

title: Specialist Data & Analytics Business Performance
description: Role purpose:Join the Vodacom Group Data & Analytics team as a member of the Business Performance team. In this team, you will have the opportunity to add meaningful value to the business and advance your analytics career as we embark on a journey to advance and digitalize the management of our KPIs. You will be responsible for the development of KPIs to support business performance management for the Vodacom Group. The function is required to ensure the organization sources all KPIs centrally from D&A with the assurance that data assets are well governed as the single version of the truth and standard data definitions are used across all reports and analytical use cases.This role will require the individual to have basic data analyst skills such as coding, data visualization creation, and the ability to reconcile different data sources. The position will allow an individual to advance their data analytical skills as well as gain considerable stakeholder management experience as they work with businesses to understand the business rules to be considered in the development of KPIs.Your responsibilities will include:KPI DevelopmentDocument the KPI definitions and supporting business rules for all Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and build KPIs from high quality and reliable data assetsKPI Availability Ensure standard use of KPIs across business through a central, self-service application for obtaining data assets, their definitions, and approved scripts. Assist business users in understanding KPIs and the related tools for accessing themData AnalysisTo support the data governance analysts in understanding the data structures and KPIs associated with each data asset.Data Reconciliation Ensure data reconciles between different systems, between user outputs and between different tables within the enterprise data warehouseBusiness Performance Obtain a detailed understanding of Vodacom’s financial and related drivers to understand business performance trends and easily identify exceptionsThe ideal candidate for this role will have:Must have technical/professional qualifications: Degree/diploma in computer science, management accounting, or related degree/diplomaKnowledge of SQL and working with relational databasesTrained in Agile to deliver as part of a high-performance diverse team across different technical capabilitiesExperience in Finance and HFM is considered to favorablebleTelecommunication experience would be advantageousCore competencies, knowledge, and experience:Data Analyst – experience in interpreting and analyzing complex & huge volumes of data through effective data processing and query languagesAnalytical Skills – Problem solving ability to identify where business processes don’t support the creation of accurate dataAgile Experience – Ability to work in an Agile squad, working in a cross functional team to ensure incremental data product deliveryReporting experience – Experience in business performance reporting for large organisations and knowledge of financial measures and related drivers.Team player: Excellent team player capable of supporting the different D&A teams with business analyst requirementsApplication knowledge: Good working knowledge of Microsoft Exchange, Word, Excel Project, PowerPoint and Visio/Bizagi and Jira.Closing date for Applications: 27 April 2023 The base location for this role is, Midrand, Vodacom Campus.The Company’s approved Employment Equity Plan and Targets will be considered as part of the recruitment process. As an Equal Opportunities employer, we actively encourage and welcome people with various disabilities to apply.Vodacom is committed to an organisational culture that recognises, appreciates and values diversity & inclusion.

title: Life Data Analyst
description: We are looking for a Life Data Analyst for a leading reinsurer based in Johannesburg. As an experienced Life insurance professional with at least 6 years' experience in the industry, you will be responsible for analysing and reporting on data content and quality, ensuring compliance with reinsurance treaty conditions and that it is fit for purpose for data users in other departments.As the ideal candidate, you should have a degree in a numerate or analytical science such as Mathematics, Computer Science or Actuarial Science, with extensive experience in working as a SQL data analyst, BI, or related field.You should also have a proven track record of delivering high-quality work within strict timelines, with the ability to communicate effectively in both technical and non-technical terms. Additionally, you should have strong analytical and numerical skills, with excellent knowledge of Microsoft Excel (able to maintain complex spreadsheets) and MS SQL Server 2012 (or later).Your main responsibilities will include liaising with internal/external clients, understanding data files and treaty rules, setting up regular processes of data receipt, cleaning, loading and reporting, as well as facilitating changes as user requirements change.This is a fixed-term contract position for 12 months and is available immediately. If you meet the minimum requirements and have the necessary skills and experience, please do not hesitate to apply!

title: Market Data Analyst - Urgent
description: I'm currently working with aMarket Leading Energy Commodity Trading business who are looking for a Market Data Analyst.The Data Management team is part of the Data Department which works very closely with the Front Office and is the center of master data management, data quality and control and it has direct responsibility over the development and maintenance of Tradings data assets.Position purposeThe Market Data Analyst will provide services towards invoice reconciliation and cost-control, market data inventory system management, enabling user permissions, terminal management and usage declarations.You will also have regular interactions with market data vendors and will be required to support the Data Management team on project where links between the datasets and the services subscribed from the vendors.Main ResponsibilitiesManage market data invoices reconcile against the inventory, process invoices, create purchase orders, one off purchases, price corrections, price changes, reviewing credit notes, calculate recharge split across the company, investigate and challenge any discrepancies, all whilst maintaining a strong relationship with internal and external finance teams.Management and upkeep of market data inventory system.Create reports, dashboards and visualisations to answer critical subscription management questions and provide market data management reporting.Maintain the data invoices and data requests mailboxes.Monitor all requests received through the mailbox and other channels in the requests tracker, aiming to meet the defined SLAs.Ensure the most updated data agreements are correctly stored in the right folder.Support the business with any non-technical data queries or contract queries.Submit the vendors Monthly and Quarterly usage declarations.Support the new vendor onboarding process along with conducting any due-diligence when required.Skills And ExperienceMinimum 2-years of relevant market data experience within financial services or a regulated environment.Knowledge of market data vendor landscape such as Bloomberg.Strong MS-office skills, especially Excel and PowerPoint.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Comfortable interacting with all teams of all levels, building a rapport and representing the Market Data Commercial Team internally and externally.Demonstrates passion, enthusiasm, can do attitude, ability to work independently and self-prioritise, a willingness to learn and make the role your own.My client is looking to recruit URGENTLY, please send your CV in Word format to be considered for this great opportunity.Etech Partners needs to collect and use your personal information when you apply for a role. We understand that you care about your privacy, and we take that seriously. Our Privacy Notice describes our policies and practices regarding collection and use of your personal data. title: HRIS Data Analyst – SF, Reporting & Matrix
description: Vivo Energy South Africa are looking for an experienced HRIS Data Analyst - SF, Reporting & Matrix to join their team!The HRIS Data Analyst will ingest and analyze data from multiple sources and create complex reports to translate business needs into meaningful insights with SAP Successfactors being the master data source. Will be responsible for using innovative and modern reporting tools and techniques to automate the most-common, repeatable, and tedious data preparation tasks and reports as well as enhancement of current reports. The role also includes a portion of day to day support of SAP Successfactors and all it’s modules including new modules to be added.Key Responsibilities:Be the leading SAP reporting representative during sustaining phases of SAP projects & day to day needs focusing on Human Capital Management.Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.Assist the operations to improve their management information and decision-making processes through sound statistical and analytical practice whilst utilising SAP tools to assist management.Strong experience in creating/building reports using SuccessFactors Report stories, canvas reporting, dashboard.Demonstrated experience working with complex business rules and SuccessFactors API’s.Previous experience in reviewing functional and technical requirements with vendors and development teams to ensure business requirements are understood and can be delivered.Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.Build complex reports by combining data from multiple data sources.Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.Work with business stakeholders to prioritize business and information needs.Building, maintaining, and supporting variety of reports utilizing appropriate reporting tools.Building customized reports and enhancement of current reports.Build data flow diagrams, process flow diagrams, dashboards and testing scenarios.Gather user requirements and collaborate with global cross-functional teams including HR, IT, and other lines of business to deliver, design and implement solutions.Oversee and support the daily administration of the SAP SuccessFactors system and its modules.Resolve a wide range of issues and incidents related to SAP Successfactors.Collaborate with HR Leadership, business process owners and other system specialists to configure, maintain, and operate the environment to support our business processes.Perform Position Master and Master Data management activities as defined by relevant policies and management instructions.Create and maintain system and process documentation and related policies and procedures.Obtaining multiple SAP SF certifications relevant to Vivo Energy.Partner with local HR teams in processing hires, job changes, terminations, organizational structure changes, Assign location, supervisory, company, and cost center, and custom organizations.Ensure data entered into the HRIS is monitored, maintained, reliable and valid.Key Challenges:Delivery of improved processes, data integrity, privacy and data quality to meet Africa and HR functional requirements; ability to analyse data integrity issues and collaborate with stakeholders to assist in process improvement efforts.Coordinate the different interfaces and communication requirements between SuccessFactors and all the non-Axiomatic payroll countries.Reconciling challenges of data within all the OU’s.Ability to meet objectives within short timeframes and prioritize deadlines from multiple stakeholders.Ability to work on multiple concurrent projects in a fast-paced environment.RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Actuarial or other related field, or equivalent work experience.Business Analytics Certification.Seasoned professional with 5+ years of work experience.Proven record of working with API’s.Data analytics and visualization experience (involved in interpreting or analyzing the data).Advanced Microsoft Excel (e.g., pivot tables, macros/VBA, data mining, report-building, PowerQuery) and PowerPoint skills required. SAP SuccessFactors Reporting Stories and/or Microsoft Power BI skills highly desired.Highly skilled with distribution within the ORD/Advanced Analytics tool within SuccessFactors.Experience in designing, defining, and executing User Acceptance Testing (UAT) test strategies, scripts, and defect management.Experience with developing job aid materials and delivering training sessions.Strong data analysis, organizational skills and problem-solving skillsSAP Successfactors Employee Central certification (advantageous)Experience in configuring, testing, implementing, administering, supporting, and reporting on SAP SuccessFactors modules, with broader knowledge across the SuccessFactors platform, including Employee Central (advantageous)If you are interested and meet the above requirements, please apply via the following link: https://apply.workable.com/vivo-energy/j/BEFA775194/
location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa

title: Finance Data Analyst
description: Cedar has partnered with a renewable energy investment company based in Hertfordshire. They are currently searching for an experienced Finance/Data Analyst to join their thriving team. The successful candidate will possess advanced skills in Microsoft Azure, SQL and Power BI.Salary: £50,000 - £60,000 per annumLocation: Buntingford, Hertfordshire (2 office days)Start date: ASAPThis is a temp to perm role on an initial 6-month contract, reporting into the Head of Business Intelligence.
